You are deep into your third drink at the Sleeping Lion when a messenger stomps in from the cold night air. You grumble a bit as the biting wind from the open door reaches your table.

The messenger appears a little lost. He is clearly looking for someone, but he isn't having much luck.

"A Red Guard," he hesitantly mumbles. "Is there a Red Guard somewhere in here?"
See what the messenger has for you.
Do your best to ignore the man and the wind.

The messenger hands over a piece of paper, and the Red Guard's expression goes dark. On the parchment is nothing but a simple image of a snake coiled around a sun, but it takes a few more drinks before the Red Guard speaks again. They explain that exile from the Red Order in Jhinda typically means death, but the Red Guard fled to Gloomhaven, and now fate has caught up with them. There is a location written on the back. The Red Guard must go soon or they will be hunted.
The messenger eventually leaves looking even more confused than when he entered.

You are enjoying a lunch of unidentifiable meat purchased from a Quatryl street vendor on the Silent Bridge when you run across a curious poster. It advertises there will be a large fighting competition in Gloomhaven Square in a matter of days.

At first, you discount it as not something worth your time, but perhaps you could be interested, if you have something to prove.
Sign up for the competition.
Ignore the poster and continue enjoying your lunch.

The Hatchet is very eager to join the competition and prove they are the greatest fighter, and so you oblige. It is an individual competition, though, so the rest of you will have to cheer from the sidelines.
The meat is very enjoyable, though it does result in some stomach pains an hour or so later.

Your purse is quite empty after a bad night of gambling at the Sleeping Lion. You are contemplating how best to cheat without getting caught when an intense negative feeling washes over you.

At first, you assume it is guilt, but you have your suspicions that it could be something far worse. You try to focus on the game, but something terrible keeps nagging at you.
Attempt to find the root of the negative energy.
Shake the nagging feeling and concentrate on the game.

The Voidwarden exits the Sleeping Lion and holds a hand up to the sky. Very quickly, they turn to the rest of the group with a panicked expression. The Voidwarden warns that something is wrong with the Void. Whatever rests inside it is stirring, and something terrible is coming as a result.
Eventually, your luck turns, and you are at least able to recover your lost money. You suppose the feeling wasn't so negative after all.

You are having a nice stroll through the New Market, perusing incredibly expensive wares you could never afford, when you spot a gruff looking man wading through the crowd. He seems out of place.

If you had to guess, you'd say he was some sort of carpenter. As he approaches, you get the feeling that you know him, but you can't quite figure out why.
Greet the man.
Ignore the feeling and carry on with your business.

The man's face lights up as you approach. You recognize him as the Demolitionist's old boss. It turns out he's actually glad to have run across you, as he has a job that you may be uniquely suited for. He has a building in the Coin District that needs to be demolished. A wealthy merchant bought the property out from under someone else to expand his own estate. The trouble is that the previous owner is said to have cursed it in a fit of rage. Destroying it may be tricky.

After a little more walking, you find a truly amazing tapestry embroidered with a great battle scene between humans and Valraths, said to be recovered from an ancient storehouse in Demonsgate. It is worth more money than you've spent in your entire life.
Emboscada na Estrada
A esposa de um ferreiro local quer informações sobre onde ele pode estar.
Investigue um ferreiro desaparecido

Um novo dia e enquanto cuida de uma ressaca infernal, você se arrasta para fora da cama para conhecer a esposa de um ferreiro local, Sandy, que conseguiu de alguma forma juntar dinheiro suficiente para contratá-lo para encontrar seu marido. Você não tem certeza de onde veio o dinheiro, mas, não importa a fonte, não pode ter sido fácil. Logo depois você se prepara para sair da cidade para o Rio Still para investigar.

É verdade, Sandy foi um pouco leve no pagamento, mas você é um dos grupos de mercenários mais conhecidos nesta porcaria de cidade. Certamente, não faz mal atender um caso de caridade de vez em quando. Afinal, conseguir bons empregos é tudo sobre manter uma boa reputação. É por isso que você realmente precisa chegar ao fundo disso e não voltar para a viúva com nada além de calos nos pés.

Além disso, você provavelmente não deveria chamá-la de viúva na cara dela, pelo menos não até que o destino do ferreiro seja confirmado.



Dado, no entanto, que nenhum dos desaparecidos voltou, as perspectivas são sombrias.

Não muito depois de passar por um dos muitos portões da cidade de Gloomhaven, você percebe um movimento à frente e imediatamente saca sua arma. O sol baixou no céu, reduzindo a visibilidade, mas você pode ver claramente algumas barricadas de madeira caindo aos pedaços bloqueando a estrada à sua frente. E, com certeza, conforme você se aproxima cautelosamente da cena, Vermlings saltam de trás das obstruções, mostrando espadas brutas e bastões afiados.

Você tem que admitir, você está bastante cansado de estar acordado até tarde na pousada ontem, mas ainda assim, esses ratos enormes certamente escolheram o grupo errado de viajantes para emboscar hoje. Este é o seu trabalho, afinal, e estão sempre prontos para mostrar que há apenas um resultado para quem ousar ameaçá-lo.

“Ser atacado por Vermlings quando tudo o que você queria fazer era ficar em casa com uma refeição quente e uma cama macia, bem, isso te deixa louco. Louco o suficiente para matar essas criaturas sarnentas antes de desmaiar de exaustão.

Claro, os Vermlings têm outros planos. Eles tagarelam sobre querer sua moeda e a carne em seus ossos. Coisas desagradáveis, realmente. Melhor ignorar o discurso deles e acabar com isso rapidamente."

Você limpa o sangue do último Vermling de seu rosto, e seus pensamentos voltam para o Leão Adormecido. Certamente, eles têm um ensopado pronto agora. Seria tão perfeitamente quente e reconfortante, e é exatamente por aquele portão - tão perto que você já pode sentir o gosto ...
Mas então, outro pensamento vem. É altamente incomum - descarado, na verdade - para um bando de Vermlings operar tão perto da cidade. Eles poderiam estar por trás da série de desaparecimentos?

É um tiro no escuro, mas vale a pena investigar, especialmente considerando que este local de emboscada não se parece com sua base de operações. Provavelmente há um ninho por perto que, com alguma sorte, terá mais informações sobre o ferreiro desaparecido.
E tesouro. Tesouro seria bom.
Um buraco na parede
É hora de descobrir de onde vieram os Vermlings que atacaram você.
Investigue a localização da Emboscada dos Vermlings

Você não pode se livrar da sensação desconfortável de que aqueles Vermlings estavam muito perto das muralhas da cidade e decidem revisitar a cena de sua emboscada. Talvez você encontre sinais do Ferreiro lá também?
Os rastros são fáceis de detectar. Vermlings nunca foram conhecidos por sua sutileza. Você segue os arranhões e os indicadores de um corpo sendo arrastado até se aproximar das paredes de Gloomhaven

O sol está muito baixo, mas algo não está certo. Isso não é apenas uma sombra projetada em uma seção inferior da parede. É um buraco. Os Vermlings fizeram um ninho para si mesmos cavando na própria parede. Quão diligente.

Você se agacha e tenta se aproximar, mas eles devem ter guardas vigiando a entrada. Há um grito estridente e, em seguida, vários Vermlings saltam da escuridão, brandindo suas armas cegas e mal feitas. Não há escolha agora a não ser se defender.

Com o ninho imundo limpo dessas criaturas miseráveis, você leva seu tempo procurando em cada canto. Certamente, a guarda da cidade vai querer saber sobre isso... não pode ser seguro ter Vermlings cavando túneis através das paredes. Já é difícil o suficiente para afastar seus ataques como são.

Sob algumas tábuas de madeira podres, você consegue encontrar uma quantidade inesperadamente grande de ouro - e enquanto vasculha o tesouro, você encontra uma nota estranha. ele detalha alguns acordos comerciais, escritos em rabiscos grosseiros, entre os Vermlings e alguém chamado Roland.

Aparentemente, em troca de fornecer cadáveres frescos, Roland pagaria aos Vermlings em ouro. E a julgar pela quantidade aqui, os Vermlings conseguiram matar uma boa quantidade de pessoas antes de você acabar com isso
É a única pista que você tem, então é hora de descobrir quem é esse tal de Roland. Depois de descansar no Leão Adormecido, claro.
O Navio Negro
Roland é a chave para os desaparecimentos, hora de começar a perguntar pela cidade sobre ele
Descubra mais sobre Roland

Depois de se fartar de ensopado e descansar bastante no Leão Adormecido, você começa cedo pela manhã. A primeira ordem do dia é procurar informações sobre alguém chamado Roland que parece estar negociando a compra de cadáveres frescos, e você gostaria de saber por quê.

É lento no começo, mas você eventualmente encontra um par de Vermlings no Mercado Afundado que parecem excessivamente interessados em descartar cadáveres. Depois de alguma persuasão grosseira, eles confessam que também estão sendo pagos por um homem chamado Roland para entregar os corpos. Eles até lhe dão o local de desembarque... algum navio abandonado na Antiga Doca.

Você desce para o cais e olha ao redor. Não demora muito para identificar o navio suspeito. Não só está vazando algum líquido preto e vil do casco, mas há dois homens vestindo mantos vermelhos montando guarda do lado de fora na doca. Depois de observá-los por algumas horas, você fica aliviado quando eles entram no navio. hora de seguir em silêncio e ver o que está acontecendo.
Parece que sua tocaia não foi tão bem sucedida quanto você pensava, os homens de manto estão prontos e esperando por você... Parece que chegar ao fundo disso vai exigir quebrar mais alguns crânios.

Você invade o porão de carga e um cheiro nefasto atinge seu rosto. Um rio de líquido preto e pegajoso flui através do navio, derramando-se entre as várias rachaduras no casco. A fonte parece estar além da porta distante, mas primeiro você terá que lutar contra mais rufiões e seus animais de estimação.

O cheiro fica ainda pior quando você finalmente abre a porta da cabine dos fundos. Mais desses loucos de manto estão realizando algum tipo de encantamento sobre um altar empilhado com membros decepados e montes de carne não identificáveis.
Com as moscas zumbindo e o estranho canto gutural, tudo o que você quer fazer é chegar o mais longe possível, mas você tem um trabalho a fazer, então você começa com a matança.
Certamente não lhe dá prazer vasculhar os restos humanos no altar, mas acaba sendo útil, entre os ataques de vômito.

Você encontra um colar... um que Sandy descreveu em detalhes como nunca deixando o pescoço de seu marido. Com isso em mãos, você pode trazer pelo menos um pouco de paz para a viúva do ferreiro e informar a guarda da cidade sobre toda essa situação.
Ainda assim, você tem uma leve suspeita de que este não é o fim da trilha. Esses homens de manto certamente eram todos subalternos, o que significa que Roland ainda está por aí.

Pode-se argumentar que este é o trabalho do guarda da cidade, mas você vasculha a cabine do navio de qualquer maneira e encontra um mapa curioso. É uma representação rudimentar do Distrito das Caldeiras, e um edifício está claramente marcado. Certamente, não faria mal dar uma olhada.
A Ritual In Stone
You recovered a map from the Black Ship, time to find out where it leads.
Follow the map you found
You arrive at the building marked on the map...an old abattoir...and find an unexpected scene. The entire building has burnt down and is now nothing more than a scorched husk.

This is certainly a new development, as you clearly remember the structure standing before you left on your hunt up the Still River. And the fact that the location has been implicated in your search, well, the whole thing is rather suspicious, even if you can’t put your finger on exactly why.

A little bit of searching through charred rubble isn’t going to stop you from getting to the bottom of this, though. Eventually, you uncover a set of stairs leading into a stone cellar. Given it’s the only piece of the structure intact, you make your way down.

A powerful smell of death grows increasingly strong as you descend, enveloping you like a suffocating blanket, until it almost overwhelms you. Thoughts of turning back creep into your mind, but then, you hear the chanting. The tone and cadence is similar to those creeps on the ship with the bloody altar.

It doesn’t take much longer to find the source. A short hallway at the base of the stairs leads into a large, open room full of more red-robed zealots. Their chanting reaches a crescendo, and the whole floor begins to shake violently. Fissures erupt from the ground around four massive, rune-covered stones. Cracks form in the ceiling, sending huge chunks of rock crashing down.
 
Your mind focuses pushing away the complications of the last few weeks. If you don’t end whatever ritual is going on right now, you will all be buried alive.
The tremors have subsided. You feel you’ve finally gotten a handle on things, but then, more men with robes rush from the deeper tunnels of this wretched place to aid the others.

You sit on the cracked stone floor and rest for just a second, eying the dark corridors leading off from this room, praying to the Oak that more enemies don’t appear from the shadows. Luckily, the exits remain silent, but that doesn’t help with your ever-increasing sense of foreboding.

Something is down in the depths of this place. So far, you’ve been blindly flailing around, trying to get to the bottom of this madness, and whatever it is...whatever answers you could hope to find...are waiting for you down that next tunnel. It’s just a matter of taking the first step.
A Deeper Understanding
A tunnel leads further underground, it is time to see what is down there
Venture deeper under Gloomhaven

You identify the most horrid-smelling of the corridors leading off from the abattoir basement to continue your search for answers... what is happening to these corpses and why. Lighting torches, you descend into the dark recesses.

Moments later, you hear the scuffling of feet and hissed whispers coming from in front of you: “The ritual has been interrupted! We will finish it at the nexus, but...” There is a brief pause and then cursing. “They approach! Quickly, stall them while we complete the preparations.”
The echo of footfalls starts to recede before another voice emerges from the darkness: “But, how? I cannot hold them off myself!”
“Open a rift!” the first voice yells, now much farther away. “They must be stopped!”

You begin to rush forward. Clearly these maniacs don’t want you to smash your way through, so that’s exactly what you’re going to do. That is, until multiple red lights appear in front of you, violently ripping open the fabric of reality into some other plane. The circle of rifts illuminate the face of the zealot at their center, full of panic and fear.

From the rifts emerge creatures of pure chaos, their movements a nightmarish flurry of claws, wings, and tendrils. One of them grabs the screaming summoner and forces him into a gaping maw in the demon’s chest. There is a wet crunch, and the man’s head disappears
While the creature finishes its meal. The others turn their attention to you. They fan out, eying you maliciously

As horrid as those creatures were, nothing could quite prepare you for what lies beyond this final stone door. A huge cocoon of bloody flesh pulsates madly in front of you, bulbous and wrong. Its seeping fluid drips to the floor as it thrashes with malevolence.
The nexus needs only a little more energy!” yells a robed man, looking to you in a panic. “We’ll just have to take yours!”

The bloody sac explodes into a shower of viscera and goo, and the zealots who spent so much energy trying to protect it collapse to the ground. It is quite the awful, putrid mess, but at least it’s over.

And then, one of the dying men laughs. “You think this will save your city? Doom approaches as more of our experiments grow in power. Gloomhaven will soon be engulfed in flames, and screams will echo throughout the streets. The Blood God will consume you all.”

Your thoughts return to the widow Sandy and you grab the man, demanding to know where Roland and these other experiments are, but he is gone. So instead, you grab a chunk of the tumor and decide to bring it to the University. Perhaps the researchers there can shed some more light on the 'situation'.
Corrupted Research
It's time to take this unpleasant chunk of the Blood Tumor to the University
Research the Tumor

Your day starts out mundane enough, delivering a bloody piece of the tumor to some stodgy researchers at the University. You walk through the halls, getting all manner of confused and dirty looks, until you arrive at the door of one Professor Haltrip, foremost researcher of organic alchemy, or so you were told by the front desk.

“Do come in!” You hear a small, gruff voice on the other side of the door. Inside, you find an old Quatryl, made even smaller by a hunched back. He is rooting around his messy office, looking for something. When he sees you, a look of disgust crosses his face, but once you produce the tumor piece, his eyes go wide with amazement.

You explain the whole situation...the disappearances, the Vermlings, the black sludge, the earthquakes, and the tumor. You explain that there are other tumors out there, used in some nefarious, unknown plot, and then the professor sits silently in thought for an uncomfortably long amount of time.

“Well, then,” he finally starts, “we’ll need to get this to my lab with all haste. There, we should be able to run some tests to figure out what it is composed of...its various signature alchemical compositions. Once we know that, then maybe we can come up with some way to track the others down.”

You hand the tumor off to him, and then, because you have no other leads, you wait in his office for what feels like hours, staring at his disorganized assortment of books, papers, and dirty bottles of foul-smelling liquid.

Then, very suddenly, your boring day becomes a lot more interesting. Haltrip bursts back into his office, his face spattered with blood. “Something has gone horribly wrong in the lab!” he screams at you and then races down the hall much faster than you would have thought possible. You follow, and he points you to a room overgrown with bloody growths, several dead lab assistants, and a swarm of monstrous rats, mutated by the growths .

“It’s going to keep spreading!” Haltrip frets. “Do something, please!”
Your weapon and face are covered in streaks of black and red...the various viscera of a number of creatures you never imagined you would have to fight before today.

"Well, then,” you hear a familiar gruff voice behind you, “this is quite the mess, and the loss of my students is a horrible tragedy...” Haltrip trails off, staring into nowhere with a forlorn look, until his eyes pass down to his hands. In them is a flat, smooth stone covered in a sticky, green film.

"But not all is bad news,” he mutters. “Based on our tests, and the violent reaction the tumor had to that last one especially, I was able to develop a method for sensing when this particular type of organic matter is near.” He hefts the stone in his hand. “That is what the green glow is.”

He then gives you each a slimy stone of your own.

You split up and spend the next several hours scouring the streets of the city, trying to locate more of the growths. In the end, you pinpoint two locations: an abandoned set of buildings in the Sinking Market and a warehouse down at the Old Docks.
With any luck, Roland is holed up in one of these places, and you can put an end to all of this.
Sunken Tumor
Your stones indicate a Tumor is under the Sunken Market, time to remove it.
Investigate the Tumor in the Sinking Market

The Sinking Market: a large area along the western coast of Gloomhaven, where you only go if you don’t have any money to steal or you want to operate outside the view of the city guard. The whole district is slowly sinking into the Merchant’s Bay, and the city has abandoned it, leaving it to rot of its own accord.

There are a great number of deserted houses in the area, half-sunk in the silt, but only one cluster shows the signs of a sinister growth within. You grip your weapon and kick in the closest door. What follows is a cacophony of screeches and the realization that Vermlings have once again entered your life. Not only that, but more of the zealots are lurking in the back of the room. More lackeys up to no good.

You glance at the blood trail leading through the door, and you know what lies on the other side: another malevolent tumor, pulsating and dripping with a foul, dark energy. You ready yourself for the fight ahead and push forward.

The pulsing of the tumor slows and then stops altogether. It is ruined, hacked up and marred beyond all recognition. The only logical thing to do is burn the remains so that it can never plague the city again.
You exit the sunken dwelling in fairly high spirits. It is done. There is one tumor left to destroy, and then hopefully the rest of these robed madmen will leave the city alone.
But then, you see it across the bay. The other tumor’s location in the Old Docks goes up in a massive column of fire. The blast wave hits you moments later, and you are knocked into the mud.
You were too late, and the explosion is surely only the beginning. You need to make your way to the Old Docks as fast as you can and stop whatever is coming next.
Hidden Tumor
Your stones indicate a Tumor is under the Old Docks, time to remove it.
Investigate the Tumor in the Old Docks

The Old Docks: were once the shining beacon of a burgeoning city’s prosperity, but after the Merchant’s Guild built their own docks on the other side of the Wall, they've become just a symbol of filth and deprivation. although there is still plenty of activity here, loading and unloading the less glamorous goods of the city like ore, hides, and fish... lots and lots of pungent fish.

The decline in business has left a number of dock warehouses abandoned, though the stink of the fish never truly leaves. It is at one of these deserted buildings that you find the signs of another sinister growth. You ready your weapon and burst through the door.

It takes your eyes a second to adjust, but then you see the unmistakable combination of claws, wings, and tendrils lurking behind the derelict shelves of long-forgotten goods. The demons emit a guttural noise from their unnatural maws, and you prepare for the assault.

You glance at the blood trail leading through the door, and you know what lies on the other side: another malevolent tumor, pulsating and dripping with a foul, dark energy. You ready yourself for the fight ahead and push forward.

The pulsing of the tumor slows and then stops altogether. It is ruined, hacked up and marred beyond all recognition. The only logical thing to do is burn the remains so that it can never plague the city again.
You exit the abandoned warehouse in fairly high spirits. It is done. There is one tumor left to destroy, and then hopefully the rest of these robed madmen will leave the city alone.

But then, you see it across the bay. The other tumor’s location in the Sinking Market goes up in a massive column of fire. The blast wave hits you moments later, and you are knocked onto the cobblestone streets.
You were too late, and the explosion is surely only the beginning. You need to make your way to the Sinking Market as fast as you can and stop whatever is coming next.
Explosive Evolution
The Tumor in the Sinking Market exploded, you need to check out the blast site
Investigate the final Tumor

You arrive at the scene, but you are clearly too late. Twisted metal and charred wood greet you as you descend into the rubble. You dig through collapsed passageways and finding the last tumor, you realise it has grown a hard outer shell...a chrysalis.

A zealot appears behind you, laughing that Roland’s plan has come to fruition. As the chrysalis explodes, a new horror emerges. It is no longer an inanimate thing, but some monstrous collection of limbs and teeth that moves with vicious efficiency.
The horror’s tendrils whip in a mad frenzy, as if trying to grasp at the life that is quickly leaving its grotesque form.

As it bleeds out onto the stone floor, its movements grow more languid, until, with one final agonized screech, its terrible mass becomes still. Around it, the undead abominations it created collapse to the ground

And with that, it is done. As far as you can tell, you’ve destroyed the awful creatures of blood that plagued the city, and in doing so, thwarted the vile group behind the disappearance of the blacksmith and so many others.

You can finally stop dodging the widow’s messages and update the city guard on everything you know. Roland seems to still be alive, but, surely, the guards can take it from here in mopping up this stupid cult, and you can go back to actually getting paid to kill things.

In fact, as you walk toward the Sleeping Lion, vaguely dreaming about a hot bath, you recall a recent rumor going around about someone along the Hook Coast offering gold to mercenaries who would come fight in his “gauntlet”. That might be worth looking into.

The Gauntlet
Surely there is gold on offer if you can beat this challenge?
Take part in 'The Gauntlet'
Anyone who builds more than a muddy tent out along the Hook Coast has to be crazy.

The area, outside the walls of Gloomhaven, is under constant threat of Vermling raids. When you arrive at the “gauntlet”, there is certainly no mistaking the air of madness that comes off its builder.
He is definitely a few branches short of a tree, ranting about some nebulous impending doom and his desire to, “weed out those unworthy to be called heroes.”

You’ve never had much desire to be a hero yourself, but he is offering an enticing 10 gold coins to anyone who can make their way through his pets and contraptions, so you put your apprehensions aside and get up onto the rickety wooden platform. Quivering black masses of ooze greet you, along with some particularly nasty-looking explosive devices.
The sound of explosions still reverberates in your skull as you make your way through a half-destroyed wooden gate and onto the next platform.

Here, you are met with an entirely new kind of madness. Golems of stone stare at you with dead eyes, while from your left, rusted iron nozzles spew out clouds of noxious gas that slowly drift across the narrow scaffolding.

You enter the final part of the platform, imagining what could possibly be worse than what you’ve already experienced. 

And then, you see the chaos demons.
You stand stunned for a moment. Why are there demons here? Just who is this crazed hermit that Built this thing?

You shake your head and steel yourself to overcome these hideous creatures. 

And then you notice the machinery attached to the traps in the room, which seem to be moving toward you. 

This should be fun, as well.
You slay the last of the creatures and step off the platform, looking for the old man. Instead, you find only a note with vaguely familiar handwriting.
“Alas, you have bested the traps that have supplied me with so many mercenary corpses in the past. I suppose it is time to move on."

You are worthy opponents... no doubt why you were able to destroy my experiments... but you are still doomed, just like the rest of the city. I encourage you to simply sit back and enjoy the mayhem... Roland”
You sigh with annoyance. Perhaps it was wishful thinking that this business was behind you. Plus, the bastard didn’t even pay you.
You take the note to the city guard, still hoping to just wash your hands of the whole situation, but they have other ideas.

Oy, good thing you lot showed up, the captain says, ignoring the note you try to wave in his face. “We’ve picked up some more activity of this blood cult. Seems some red-robed fellows have been sighted moving in and out of the sewers in two seperate city districts.

I can’t get any of my own men to go down there, but if your famous mercenary company is willing to head into the sewers to investigate, I’d be willing to pay a hefty sum. Provided you come back alive, of course.

Flattery normally doesn’t sway you, but the “hefty sum” certain sounds good. The captain shows you the spots where the robed men have been sighted: in the slums of the Sinking Market and the much nicer streets of the Traveler’s District.
Defiled Sewers
The town guard suggested you'd find some of the red robed men here
Check for Zealots in the Sinking Market

You light torches as you stand before a sewer entrance in the Sinking Market, half submerged in some foul liquid. If there is anything worse than the Sinking Market, it is the sewer beneath it...a breeding ground for Vermlings, snakes, and other unsavory things. And it just smells really bad.

You think for a moment how you could have gone to the Traveler’s District, the nicest area of the city. But oh no, no, you had to come here, because you can’t think of a more fitting location to find those wretched blood cultists.

And so, you hold your nose and make your way in. It doesn’t take long to find a whole mess of unpleasantness...a nest of snakes and black sludge blocks the passage.
It seems you’ll need to head upstream through the main tunnel, but the way is blocked by a huge iron sluice gate.
Seeing no other way through this awful place than the old door on the opposite side of the sewage river, you push it open and hope for the best.
What you get though is a nest of Vermlings. But behind the group, near a tunnel in the wall, you spot a rusty lever.

You pull on the lever and hear a great rush of water behind you.

Looking back you see the main tunnel that was blocked off is now open, but a torrent of water trapped behind the gate is now free, overflowing the river.
A way forward has opened. You’ll just have to fight against the current to get there.

Toward the back end of the tunnel, past the gate, you are able to climb up onto a higher platform, out of the reach of the rushing waters. Eventually, the torrent subsides, but not before it washes the rest of the monsters off toward the bay.
Hopefully, deeper into these tunnels you’ll find what this blood cult is up to. You're also curious about that hole the Vermlings dug in the side room. It might be worth investigating.
Beguiling Sewers
The town guard suggested you'd find some of the red robed men here
Check for Zealots in the Traveler's District
The Traveler’s District, where the wealthiest merchants of the city live in their giant estates, is certainly the nicest part of Gloomhaven.

You are skeptical that an area policed so heavily by the city guard would be a breeding ground for cultists, but, as the captain said, the guards rarely patrol the sewers, so it’s possible something untoward is happening down there.

When you enter, you are surprised at how immaculate the tunnels are. Something is off. Sewers shouldn’t be this clean, and you feel a strange energy emanating from the pillars in this room. Looking closely by torchlight, you see small circular runes scribed all over them. Some trickery is definitely at work, and the only thing you can think to do is smash the pillars and uncover what is really going on.
As the last of the pillars falls, the far wall flickers in and out of sight, and two archways suddenly appear, leading into a darkness beyond.
A strong smell of death reaches your nostrils, as a purple mist creeps at the edge of your vision and more strange energy emanates beyond.
The purple mist dissipates, and with it, any illusion of a pristine sewer. The rich produce waste just like anyone else.
It was all an illusion...even the horrific corpses and spirits. You raise your torch to get a better view of your new surroundings and notice a passageway deeper into the bowels of this place.
Perhaps this is what was being concealed by this whole facade. You step into the passage, intent on finding out what the cult is up to now.
Before too long, you come across a simple ladder back up to the surface, but it seems to lead directly into one of the estates.
As you pass - you can’t help but notice the opportunity to sneak into someones fancy house and get a little bit richer.
Vile Harvest
Continue deeper into the sewers under the Sinking Market
The deeper sewers need exploring

You walk through the main tunnel for quite a while. The flow of the sewage running through it lessens over time, until the water is almost completely gone, leaving nothing but a thick, acrid layer of slime.

And then, you see the movement up ahead at the edge of your torchlight. Small creatures - at first, you think they are more Vermlings, but these are wet - living globules of some dark red liquid. This is surely the work of the blood cult.

After fighting your way through the horrible little blood creatures, you are almost relieved not to find them in the final chamber. You’ve found more of the zealots, though, once again caught in some foreboding ritual.

Something is definitely not right.
Black sludge languishes in a basin of fetid water in the back of the room, and as the cultists chant, you see a mass of red - growing inside the ooze.
They are producing the vile blood creatures through this dark ritual, and it must be stopped.
This factory of revulsion has been shut down. Every vile creature is now smashed and scattered across the floor. This is not the end, though.

These cultists refuse to talk or give up Roland, so the only option is to continue forward. Ahead, another passage leads deeper into this blood-soaked nightmare. More evil awaits. You feel it in your bones.
Toxic Harvest
Continue deeper into the sewers under the Traveler's District
The deeper sewers need exploring

Given the lengths someone went to in order to hide this passage of the sewers, you are sure it will lead somewhere meaningful. With any luck, you’ll find the last vestiges of the blood cult, cowering in a corner, and finish them off once and for all.

Of course, nothing is as simple as that. After some investigation, you begin to hear chanting and the hissing of snakes in the tunnel ahead of you.
You move forward and demand to know where Roland is, but these blood-obsessed idiots are not particularly talkative.

You try to block the image of the bloody nightmares clawing their way out of their serpent hosts as the zealots watched and smiled. Blood given sentience? and some vile intent? - the thought fills you with an empty sense of inevitability

And this was not the worst of it. These cultists refuse to talk or give up Roland, so the only option is to continue forward. Ahead, another passage leads deeper into this blood-soaked nightmare. More evil awaits. You feel it in your bones
Tainted Blood
Your journey into the sewers has led here, what is waiting?
Clear the deepest part of the sewers

“So, you come once again to ruin my work,” a voice echoes through the dark tunnels of the sewer. It is the voice of that crazed hermit from the Hook Coast...the voice of Roland...and it drips with venom. “If only you realized how futile your efforts were. In fact, not just futile but helpful."

“We did not even realize what glorious gift our god had given us until that incident at the University. To think that the corruption we cultivated could, under the right conditions, spread so rapidly, infecting new hosts and warping them into His image.”

You move forward, waving your torch to illuminate every corner of the darkness, but you can’t find the source of the voice.

“And we have already poured HIS gift into the water supply. It is too late. Before long, everyone in the city will be a slave to the Blood God, and then you can sit back and watch the mayhem!”
You roar and charge forward, straight into an alcove where you find a robed man hunched in front of an alchemy table.
His vials bubble over with a black liquid that splashes onto the stone floor, running in little rivulets under a door behind him. This is not Roland, but you figure you should kill him all the same.
Your triumphant victory is short-lived. You are in an area under Gloomhaven where the water from the Still River is diverted into cisterns to supply the city.

Looking over the smashed equipment, you see the streams of black liquid snaking from overturned beakers into the flowing water, and it is clear that the cities water supply is tainted, there is nothing you can do to reverse that now.
You search the broken corpses of the cultists for Roland, but all you find is some loose gold.

The only thing to be done is to take a sample of the liquid back to the University. They got you into this mess, and with any hope, Professor Haltrip can come up with some counteracting agent to distribute before all of the cities inhabitants turns into monstrosities.
Mixed Results
Return to the University, perhaps they can help the city
Revisit Professor Haltrip

You burst into Professor Haltrip’s office, holding a vial of the black liquid. The old Quatryl looks understandably alarmed, but you waste no time in explaining the situation quickly and calmly to him until a determined look settles on his face.

“Once again, it is up to me to save the city, eh?” he asks, standing from his cluttered desk. “And we don’t have the luxury of time. I think we can throw together some tests, but it won’t be easy - or pretty."

“We’ll need to inject a number of specimens with variations on this toxin and observe how they deal with different stimuli. With enough data, we should be able to formulate a concoction that will arrest the transformation.”

He exits his office and leads you down the hallway to his lab. “The stimuli will be where you come in. I found your last foray in my lab to be very helpful in expediting the data collection, so I’ll need something similar here. It will be more controlled, of course, but we need to collect as much data as we can, as quickly as we can, so we’ll be dealing with large groups of specimens at once.”

Haltrip passes the black vial along to a new assistant, then directs you into a small laboratory. After you enter, he closes and locks the door from the other side. “Not to worry, the tests will be over before you know it. Let’s begin with the first phase.”
Haltrip bangs on the glass of the window between rooms and gives you a thumbs up.
"Begin phase two!” he yells emphatically. He is much happier than he should be, given the circumstances.
"On to phase three!” Haltrip yells. “We got a lot of good data on the last one, so, with any luck, this next test will conclude the study!”
With the final test complete, Haltrip bursts into the lab. You almost turn your weapons on him after what he put you through, but his exuberance is infectious
“There it is!” he cries. “That last strain, that was the key! I’ve got my assistants working on it now...an agent that will completely neutralize the toxin’s effects.
And once it is ready, we will use all the resources the University has at its disposal to distribute the agent across the city. With luck, we will avert this crisis in time!”

His face bunches up at the edges of his mouth in a smile. He beams with wrinkly pride, and you almost crack a smile yourself before a thunderous boom reverberates through the building. Haltrip’s smile disappears.
That came from the southeast, Haltrip starts... “It sounded like a lightning strike, but it’s not even raining.”
You rush outside just in time to see a pillar of red light shoot down from the sky and connect with the Old Wall Gate. Seconds later, another boom echoes across the city.
This is undoubtedly the work of Roland and his Blood God. What other tricks can they possibly have up their sleeves? There’s only one way to find out.
Red Twilight
Gloomhaven is under attack, head to the Old Wall Gate!
Defend the Old Wall Gate

The sun dips low on the horizon as you race to the Old Wall Gate. Periodic flashes of red light combined with the setting sun make it look as if the sky is ablaze. You arrive at the scene to witness a gathering of red-robed zealots prostrate in front of the gate, racked with pain.

“They’ve ingested the gift,” a voice booms down from above. “They are devoted to the cause, and so the Blood God gives us the strength to enact HIS plan.” A hulking figure stands atop the Old Wall. His stature has certainly changed, but not his face... it is Roland.

As you try to puzzle out what is going on, another column of red light crashes down, engulfing Roland. He cackles with delight, and his frame seems to grow even larger.

“You attempt to inoculate the city against His influence, but He will not allow it!” Roland bellows. “None of the meddlers from the University will enter the east city. I am HIS avatar of destruction, and I deem it so!”
On the ground in front of you, the robed men scream out in agony as they begin to grow as well. Fleshy, unnatural lumps of muscle sprout from their frames, warping their bodies into monstrosities.
Their robes begin to rip under the strain, their faces distorted and unrecognizable, as they scream out in a hateful cacophony.
“Destroy all who dare stand against us!” Roland commands as he heads into the city.
“Ah, so nice of you to join me,” Roland laughs.
He lifts his massive sword aloft, and a flash of red lightning shoots down from the sky, connecting with the tip of the blade, causing it to crackle with energy.
“Come, let me show you the full extent of the Blood God’s anger.”
You briefly consider fleeing, but you see more of the monstrosities gathering in the streets around you. Your only hope is to kill Roland or this madness will never end.
Roland laughs as he bleeds profusely from numerous wounds. He spits out a mouthful of blood, preparing to give one more speech about his stupid god and their idiotic plan.
“I just need a little more energy,” he coughs. With a smile he raises his sword once again to the sky. But no lightning comes. Roland frowns, a confused look on his face.
“My glorious master,” he pleads with great effort and visible strain. “I just need a little more help...”

He drops to his knees, and his minions turn to ash, blown away by the wind comming from the sea. As you approach with your weapon at the ready, his hulking form shrinks until he once again resembles the frail old man from the Hook Coast.
No... he groans, and then you strike.
It is done. Your quarry lies dead on the blackened stone, covered in the blood he coveted so much.
“What is the meaning of this?” The captain of the guard runs up to you from a nearby street. There is a full squad of soldiers behind him.
You explain what happened, reminding him about the gold he promised for investigating the sewers. You emphasize how far above and beyond that you ended up going.
He thanks you with a hefty purse of coins, and you leave the scene in his capable hands. Your next stop is the widow Sandy, where you inform her that her husband’s death has been fully avenged.
It doesn’t seem to relieve her grief all that much, but it makes you feel better at least.
Finally, with the weight of this madness off your shoulders, you return to the Sleeping Lion with your head held high.
As you enter the inn, the shift in tone is immediate. The conversations grow hushed, and there are many furtive glances your way.
Suddenly, a group in the corner starts slamming cups of ale on their table in a clear rhythm. The name of your mercenary guild is called out, once and then again...
It becomes a chant and grows louder until the whole front room is caught in the uproar. A smile creeps onto your face. It’s good to be home.
The Heist
The secret passage led to this merchant's house, are they connected, or is this an opportunity for some loot?
Use a secret passage to check out a merchant's house

Of course, you would not normally go out of your way to creep into some wealthy merchant’s house and steal their valuables. You’re not a common criminal, after all, but the entrance to this estate was behind the illusory wall in the Traveler’s District sewers, implying its resident might somehow be involved in this whole mess. You just want to take a look around, and if you happen to find a valuable or two, well so be it.
You quietly climb up out of the sewer entrance into a grand entryway, complete with a couple of impressive stone statues. It doesn’t seem like anyone is home, so it’s time to see what you can find.
You search through a chest of valuables and pocket as much as you can, but then, something strange happens. The statue behind you starts to move.
You watch in a panic as it climbs down off its pedestal and begins to stomp toward you, menacingly.
The threat is now real. More statues are coming to life than you can handle, so it is time to get out of here. At least the things are slow. They shouldn't be able to follow you.
As you head back to the entrance, though, you see more of the statues moving into position. They have you surrounded.
You really hope those statues can’t use ladders as you quickly descend back into the sewers.
It didn’t quite go as planned, and you didn’t really find any incriminating evidence, but you are a lot richer, so you’ll call it a win.
Den of Thieves
You found a secondary tunnel to a Vermling den under the City, it should be cleared
Destroy the Vermling den

Any Vermling nest within the city can be problematic, but the possibility that these Vermlings may be consorting with those red-robed madmen or infected by their experiments, well, it’s probably best just to exterminate the lot of them.

You move past the old rusted lever, through the dug-out tunnel, into an older network of sewer passageways. You don’t have to go that far before you find the savage little creatures, their fur matted with oozing growths. They scream and wave their crude weapons at you. This place needs to be destroyed, but maybe you can find more information on the cult as well.

It is rough work, destroying these nests while being attacked on all sides. Given the presence of the deformed rats, it is pretty clear there is some connections between the Vermlings and the blood cult, but you fail to locate any additional evidence.
All you find for your effort is an interesting ring that could be of some value. With the infection eradicated, you make your exit.
Misplaced Goods
An Inox sea captain wants you to recover the goods that were stolen from her.
Recover some stolen items
You follow the directions of the grizzled Inox sea captain to a warehouse in the Old Docks where she suspects her goods are hiding.
You’re not quite sure what to expect when you push through the oaken door into the dimly lit stockroom.

Various sundries are scattered everywhere, as if stored hastily. And near the center of the room, you see the culprits - a group of chaos demons none too happy about you barging in. Fighting them will be one thing, but finding the right goods in this mess will be an entirely different matter. Who knows what is in store for you?
Well, you’ll have nightmares about apples for a week, but you finally find all of the Inox’s missing goods and return to her ship at the docks for your reward.

“Wonderful!” she praises. “We need to push off for Velcyll Harbor first thing tomorrow, and it would have been a much less lucrative trip if you hadn’t have recovered these. They’ll sell well in the Orchid shops."
She hands over your "reward", and you wish her well on her journey - the cheapskate.
Agents of Chaos
A Valrath has paid you to investigate strange goings on in the New Docks
What is occurring in the New Docks?

“Demons,” they say. Judging by what you’ve seen recently, you certainly wouldn’t discount it. There has just been one thing after another with this city recently, so why should the New Docks be any different?

You follow the directions of the merchant to a collection of small warehouses deep into the district. As you approach, a strange feeling washes over you. Something is definitely not right, and you can feel it in the air. There is a palpable malice that permeates everything and claws at the back of your mind. It takes everything you have to not simply flee the scene and never look back. Instead, you draw your weapon and get to work.
This storeroom is deathly quiet, but the terrible feeling only intensifies. Something is hiding in here, and you’ll figure out what it is, even if you have to destroy everything.
The pain in the back of your skull throbs deeper as you step into the room. You feel your psyche being shred to ribbons, but you have to advance and put a stop to this insidiousness.
You enter the storeroom and see suspicious movement through the weapon shelves. This is followed by the sound of hissing and a number of snakes slithering out of the darkness toward you.
Strangely, you sense they are being protected by some malevolent force in the back of the room.
As the final demon dies, the aura of malice around the area is lifted. You happily feel your sanity coming back.
You return to the Valrath merchant to give him the good news and get paid for your efforts.
Unfriendly Message
The Redguard must go to this meeting or risk being hunted
A meeting for the Redguard

You arrive at the appointed time in a dark alley near the city’s west wall. You fully expected an ambush and are not disappointed. What is disappointing, however, is that those hunting the Red Guard didn't come themselves... Instead, they sent proxies...some lowly Vermlings and an enchanted golem.
The Red Guard was hoping for some further communication, but your foes wordlessly attack upon your arrival. When the golem moves, though, you notice it's not a standard creation.
It is forged with strong magic, incorporating a horde of rare, venomous snakes from the Red Desert. The message is perfectly clear, and it is deeply personal.
Your victory has bought the Red Guard more time. But there is no doubt, more terrible things will come.
Valraths do not forgive so easily, but the Red Guard is free for today, and, what’s more, you find a ring at the heart of the golem’s gears.
It seems to be a simple circle of steel, but you can feel it still has some energy from the Jhinda forge.
It takes a long time before the Red Guard speaks again.
Best of the Best
The Hatchet wants to prove they are the greatest fighter in Gloomhaven
Is the Hatchet 'The Best Around'?
You arrive at Gloomhaven Square for the competition and see the entire area has been converted into a huge arena with stadium seating around the outside.

The Hatchet moves over to the contestants’ area while the rest of you take your seats to watch the spectacle.

The competition itself is brutal. One unprepared drudge after another faces off against a host of monsters, and none of them fare very well. The lucky ones are those who leave the arena alive.

Then, the Hatchet enters the stage. It’s time to give these people a show.
The last of the aggressors falls, and the Hatchet stands victorious. The crowd goes wild, cheering and hooting in a frenzy.
You can see the Hatchet crack a smile under the shade of his hat - a truly rare occurrence.

The organizers award the Hatchet with a finely crafted weapon as a prize, and you don’t stick around to see if anyone else survives the carnage. Surely, they have no chance of putting on a better show.
Warding The Void
Something is stirring within the Void and the Voidwarden must keep the barriers up
The Voids wards must be protected
You arrive at the southeastern edge of the Void to find a massive storm raging inside. Great gusts of wind blow the black sand up into skin grating torrents.

The Voidwarden marches forward and plants three wards in the cobblestone. The winds abate a bit, but the area still seems incredibly dangerous.

The Voidwarden turns and explains that these wards should keep whatever stirs at bay, but that the Void will send what forces it can to break them. You must stand between the enemy and the wards to make sure the city remains safe.
You relax a bit, having destroyed a wave of terrible creatures, but the Voidwarden does not let down their guard. More are coming. This fight is not over.
Sure enough, as you crush the charging demon, more begin to materialize behind it. Your energy is flagging, and you desperately hope this is the last of them.

You fall back behind the wards, praying that was the last of the creatures but resolving to fight until your final breath if you must. Luckily, that won’t be necessary. The winds die down. The crisis is averted.
The Voidwarden is determined to stay here for the rest of the night to make sure the threat has truly passed. The rest of you though head back to the Sleeping Lion.
When you reconvene in the morning, the Voidwarden has a new set of robes. You don’t ask any questions.
The Greatest Job in the World
The Demolitionist has a job to destroy a cursed warehouse
A Demolition for a Demolitionist
The Demolitionist just can’t say “no” to a good demo job. There’s no greater feeling than that which comes from breaking everything in sight
You gear yourself up and head over to the derelict building slated for destruction.

The building has been abandoned for a while, plus there’s the whole “curse” thing, so you’re not sure what to expect when you walk inside. You feel the presence of some lingering spirits, but they’re not going to stop you from getting to work.
There is a long groan followed by a sharp crack. The roof buckles, and then the whole thing comes crashing down at once, kicking up a huge cloud of dust in a cacophany of noise.
You are blinded and deafened for a brief moment, but as the dust clears, you see the job well done in front of you. The building is destroyed, and any sort of haunting has dissipated.
The Demolitionist reports back to the foreman and then uses the earnings to build themselves a fancy new pair of boots.
